meanings.definition: A person or thing that casts, especially a fishing rod.
meanings.sent1: The skilled fisherman carefully attached the bait to his casters before casting his line into the water.
meanings.sent2: The casters on the fishing rod made it easier for the angler to throw the line far into the lake.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat mistook the shiny casters on the fishing rod for toys and tried to play with them.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like skilled casters, effortlessly casting out ideas that hooked the audience's attention.
meanings.sent5: The casters on the fishing rod danced gracefully through the air, landing the bait in the perfect spot.

meanings.definition: Small wheels on a swivel attached to the legs or base of a piece of furniture to make it easier to move.
meanings.sent1: The heavy cabinet was easy to move thanks to the smooth-rolling casters on its legs.
meanings.sent2: She added casters to the bottom of the chair so she could easily slide it across the room.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy thought the casters on the chair were toys and chased them around the house.
meanings.sent4: The casters on the table legs whispered softly as they glided effortlessly across the wooden floor.
meanings.sent5: With the casters in place, the desk became a swift and nimble piece of furniture, ready to be rearranged at a moment's notice.

meanings.definition: A member of the cast of a play or movie.
meanings.sent1: The talented casters rehearsed their lines together to ensure a flawless performance on opening night.
meanings.sent2: She was thrilled to be chosen as one of the casters for the upcoming Broadway production.
meanings.sent3: The casters of the play decided to play a prank on the director by switching roles during rehearsal.
meanings.sent4: Each member of the cast was like a unique color on a vibrant palette, blending together to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The casters brought their characters to life on stage, captivating the audience with their heartfelt performances.
